articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ford Motor (F.N) on Monday slashed the prices of its popular electric F-150 Lightning trucks, with the base variant now starting at about 16.6% less, amid an electric vehicle (EV) price war started by market leader Tesla (TSLA.O).
articles.title: Ford slashes prices of F-150 Lightning trucks, base variant to cost 17% less

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The chief executives of U.S. chip companies are holding meetings with Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo and key White House officials Monday as they discuss China policy, a source told Reuters.
articles.title: Biden administration holding meetings with chips companies -- source

articles.author: Howard Schneider
articles.description: Since the Federal Reserve decided to keep interest rates on hold at its June 13-14 policy meeting, U.S. central bank officials have given every indication they are ready to approve another small rate increase when they gather again next week.
articles.title: Is the wild ride over? Fed faces broader debate as it tees up rate hike

articles.author: Michael Derby
articles.description: Americans are increasingly getting shot down when they seek out loans, new data from the New York Fed, released Monday, said.
articles.title: NY Fed report finds Americans increasingly facing borrowing headwinds

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Wall Street's top regulator is developing rules to govern the use of artificial intelligence on trading platforms, which poses a risk of conflicts of interest, the agency chief said in a speech on Monday.
articles.title: US SEC developing rules on AI 'conflicts of interest'

articles.author: Chibuike Oguh
articles.description: Shares of AT&T Inc (T.N) fell more than 5% to hit their lowest level in thirty years on Monday, after analysts downgraded the stock following a news report that the telecommunications giant left toxic lead cables buried across the United States.
articles.title: AT&T shares hit three-decade low as lead cables risk weighs

articles.author: Jonathan Saul
articles.description: Insurers are reviewing whether to freeze cover for any ships willing to sail to Ukraine after Russia said on Monday it will suspend participation in a UN-backed deal that allows the export of grain through a Black Sea safe corridor, sources said.
articles.title: Insurers reviewing Black Sea ship cover after Russia suspension - sources

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia halted participation on Monday in the year-old U.N.-brokered deal which lets Ukraine export grain through the Black Sea, just hours after a blast knocked out Russia's bridge to Crimea in what Moscow called a strike by Ukrainian sea drones.
articles.title: Moscow halts grain deal after bridge to Crimea struck

articles.author: Charlie Devereux
articles.description: Global temperatures headed towards alarming highs and extreme weather proliferated as the world's two biggest polluters, China and the United States, sought on Monday to reignite climate talks.
articles.title: Heatwaves: world reels from wildfires, floods as US and China discuss climate crisis

articles.author: Anna Tong, Jeffrey Dastin
articles.description: Around a decade after virtual assistants like Siri and Alexa burst onto the scene, a new wave of AI helpers with greater autonomy is raising the stakes, powered by the latest version of the technology behind ChatGPT and its rivals.
articles.title: Insight: Race towards 'autonomous' AI agents grips Silicon Valley
